thread.title: Epcot International Food & Wine Festival marks 20 years at Walt Disney World [Photos]
thread.title_full: Epcot International Food & Wine Festival marks 20 years at Walt Disney World [Photos]

title: Epcot International Food & Wine Festival marks 20 years at Walt Disney World [Photos]
text:
Beth J. Harpaz, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS First posted: Saturday, September 12, 2015 08:00 AM EDT Test your knowledge of Disney Parks with our fun trivia Previous Next 
Sure, you've vacationed there, but how much do you really know about Walt Disney World and Disneyland? Check out our fun facts and Disney trivia to test your knowledge on all things Disney Parks. (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
There are four theme parks at Walt Disney World. Can you name them all? (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
Answer: Magic Kingdom, Epcot, Disney’s Hollywood Studios and Disney’s Animal Kingdom. (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
Employees of Disney Parks are called Cast Members. Can you guess how many Cast Members work at Walt Disney World? (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
Answer: There are more than 70,000 Cast Members working at Walt Disney World. The average employee stays for nine years. (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
This castle sits at the centre of Walt Disney World's Magic Kingdom. What Disney princess does it belong too? (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
Answer: The castle is called Cinderella's Castle. (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
There are 11 nations represented at Epcot's World Showcase Lagoon. Can you name them all? (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
Answer: The countries are Canada (pictured), United Kingdom, France, Japan, America, Italy, Germany, China, Mexico, Morocco and Norway. (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
What TV sports network has a sports complex within Walt Disney World? (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
Answer: The 230-acre ESPN Wide World of Sports Complex features facilities for training, competition, festivals and tournaments. (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
Walt Disney World is planning to expand the Animal Kingdom park with a new attraction featuring the blue humanoid species called Na'vi, created by director James Cameron. Can you name the movie in which the Na'vi are featured? (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
Answer: It's Avatar! Disney World is working with Cameron to bring Avatar to life with "awe-inspiring floating mountains and ... a nighttime jungle of bioluminescent plants that are alive with light and sound." (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
Mickey Mouse is one stylish mouse. Can you guess how many outfits Mickey has? (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
Answer: Try spotting Mickey in one of his 136 outfits when visiting Walt Disney World. Outfits range from a scuba suit to a safari outfit to a tuxedo. Minnie Mouse has more than 100 different outfits. (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
Stay hydrated! Can you guess how many cans of Coca Cola and bottles of water are consumed at Walt Disney World each year? (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
Answer: More than 75 million cans of Coca Cola and more than 13 million bottles of water are consumed by Walt Disney World visitors each year. (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
The world's largest sand-bottom pool at Walt Disney World Beach Club Resort's Stormalong Bay, holds how many gallons of water? (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
Answer: 750,000 gallons of water. (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
What theme park opened first: Disney World or Disneyland? (Courtesy Disneyland) 
Answer: Walt Disney himself opened Disneyland in California in 1955. (Courtesy Disneyland) 
Disneyland's Matterhorn Bobsleds was the world's first tubular steel roller coaster. Can you guess what year it opened? (Courtesy Disneyland) 
Answer: 1959. (Courtesy Disneyland) 
'It's a Small World' is one of the most iconic attractions at Disneyland. Can you guess how many people have ridden 'It's a Small World' since it opened in 1966? (Courtesy Disneyland) 
Answer: 256 million guests have experienced 'It's a Small World' at Disneyland alone. Disney World in Florida also has a version of the attraction. (Courtesy Disneyland) 
Disneyland and Disney World weddings are popular for brides and grooms who are fans of Disney. Can you guess how many wedding cakes the bakers at Disneyland make each year? (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
Answer: About 250 wedding cakes a year are baked and decorated in the Disneyland Hotel pastry kitchen. (Courtesy Walt Disney World) 
Disneyland created the first one of these in the western hemisphere. (Courtesy Disneyland) 
Answer: Daily operating monorail. (Courtesy Disneyland) 
Disney created a popular movie series, starring Johnny Depp, based on one of it's attractions. What is it? (WENN.com) 
Answer: Pirates of the Caribbean. This attraction, opened in 1967, was the last supervised by Walt Disney himself. (Courtesy Disneyland) 
Visit Disneyland's Tomorrowland, where you can see the iconic Captain EO movie, starring this late singer. (Courtesy Disneyland) 
Answer: Michael Jackson stars in Captain EO. The movie ran at Disneyland from 1986 to 1996, but returned in 2010 to honour Jackson after his death. George Lucas produced the movie and Francis Ford Coppola directed. (WENN.com) 
Disneyland's first ever ride-through attraction that takes you under the sea is an adventure with this favourite red-headed mermaid. Who is she? (Courtesy Disneyland) 
Answer: Ariel, Prince Eric, Sebastian and Ursula are along for the ride on Disneyland's Ariel's Undersea Adventure. (Courtesy Disneyland) 
Board one of Disneyland's eight submarines for an underwater adventure to find this adorable little clown fish. Who is he? (Courtesy Disneyland) 
Answer: Nemo! See if you can find Nemo on Disneyland's Finding Nemo Submarine Voyage. (Courtesy Walt Disney Pictures)
